intro: Pterocephalus incanus, commonly known as the desert flax, is a flowering plant native to arid regions of Central Asia. It is a member of the Apiaceae family, which includes carrots and parsley, and is characterized by its slender, branched stems and small, yellowish flowers. The plant produces small, spherical fruits that are covered in fine, white hairs, giving it a distinctive appearance. It is adapted to survive in dry, sandy environments and has a deep root system to access water. Pterocephalus incanus is often used in traditional medicine and is also valued for its ornamental qualities.
